intro: Artemisia tilesii var. elatior, commonly known as the tall tarragon, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that appear in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
